heisig_chinese_memo: One horizontal stroke representing the number one.
heisig_story: In Chinese characters, the number one is laid on its side, unlike the Roman numeral I which stands upright. As you would expect, it is written from left to right.
koohiiStory2: To learn this one kanji, I recommend (#2000) this story : Bambi is in a cave, eating a side-dish of salad when trying to learn the kanjis. As he succeed to learn the kanji for "one", you get jealous and decide to shoot him with a slingshot. At this moment you hear the police coming, so you hurriedly burn all the proofs into a fire (so you remove the key-words Bambi, slingshot and fire from recommend). So that when the police arrives, the only remaining clue is a single horizontal bar.

WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Lying on the ground is something that looks just like the ground, the number One. Why is this One lying down? It's been shot by the number two. It's lying there, bleeding out and dying. The number One doesn't have long to live.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: To remember the meaning of One, imagine yourself there at the scene of the crime. You grab One in your arms, trying to prop it up, trying to hear its last words. Instead, it just splatters some blood on your face. "Who did this to you?" you ask. The number One points weakly, and you see number Two running off into an alleyway. He's always been jealous of number One and knows he can be number one now that he's taken the real number one out.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: As you're sitting there next to One, holding him up, you start feeling a weird sensation all over your skin. From the wound comes a fine powder (obviously coming from the special bullet used to kill One) that causes the person it touches to get extremely itchy (ã„ã¡).
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Make sure you feel the ridiculously itchy sensation covering your body. It climbs from your hands, where you're holding the number One up, and then goes through your arms, crawls up your neck, goes down your body, and then covers everything. It becomes uncontrollable, and you're scratching everywhere, writhing on the ground. It's so itchy that it's the most painful thing you've ever experienced (you should imagine this vividly, so you remember the reading of this kanji).

origin_of_ch_char_book: Before the invention of Hanzi (Chinese characters), the Chinese used knots (rope) or simple symbols. As the society became more complex, the need for more efficient ways for communication were needed. Hanzi (Chinese characters) were developed to meet such needs. What did the early writers think to express number â€œoneâ€? As children use their fingers to count, the ancient people used twigs and sticks to express numbers and to count. A twig (ä¸€, yi, one), two twigs (äºŒ, er, two), three twings (ä¸‰, san, three) four twigs (å››, si=ssu, four) became the letters from 1 to 4. Branches used for telling fortunes or for calculation (14th-19th century) However, â€œoneâ€ ä¸€ (yi, one) does not simply mean the number one in the numerical sense. In AD 100, a Chinese scholar wrote a book â€œShuo Wen Jie Ziâ€ which provides many explanations behind Hanzi. Among over 9,000 Hanzi characters in this book, the â€œone (ä¸€)â€ is explained first as followed: â€œIn the beginning there was only One Way, and this Way divided earth from heaven and made everything.â€ As we can see, â€œoneâ€ is not just a simple tree twig. It is also philosophically understood as the â€œsole principleâ€ from which heaven, earth and living things originate d from.,(ä¸€, yi, One) influenced its philosophical meaning to establish (å¤©, tian=tâ€™ien, heaven). This character is a combination of â€œa big manâ€ (å¤§, da, big) and the one and only and higher (ä¸€, yi, one). In other words, it expresses something higher than the highest person. The common person or man is expressed as bending his waist like this: (äºº, ren, human). When expressed as (å¤§, da, big), it means someone more powerful than a common man. Therefore, (å¤©, tian=tâ€™ien, heaven) means someone higher than the big man, the one and only being, that is the God who lives in Heaven. Therefore, this letter is currently being used as a meaning for Heaven, Day, or God.,The represent of a village is reading a written prayer to God in the early 20th century The character ç¬¬ (di, auxiliary word for ordinal numbers) is also from this character under the same logic. The top of this character means bamboo (ç«¹), the material of spear, and below is the rope which winds the spear. For example, ç¬¬ä¸€ (di yi) means â€˜the firstâ€™ (the first rope of the spear), ç¬¬äºŒ (di er) means â€˜the secondâ€™.
humanum_full_description_en:
Jia Jinwen expresses the concept of one with an abstract horizontal line. "Said Wen": "One, but the beginning of the Taishi, the Tao stands in one, makes heaven and earth, and transforms into all things. All the belongings of one are from one. Yi, the ancient text is one." Press "å¼Œ" from " Ge " from " Ge " The character form of " one " evolved, which is the red text of " one ". After the Spring and Autumn Period to the ancients " a filling sound character on" " Yi ." Because the lower part of the character " Yi " is mixed with " Ge " by adding a pen, so the inscriptions and bamboo slips of the Warring States period are mostly from " Ge " to "ä¸€", such as Genghu and Guodian bamboo slips "Qing Da Yi " Time" Jane 14.

He Linyi believes that from " Ge " from "ä¸€" to "æˆŒ" from "ä¸€", the word " Ge " was later saved as " yi ", so the ancient text recorded in " Suowen " is written as "å¼Œ". It can be inferred from the font of "è´°" of Baihu ğ£ª• in Five Years Zhao that "ä¸€" may also be written from "æˆŒ". Only the glyph of "æˆŒ" from "ä¸€" is not seen in ancient writing materials, so let me explain here. See " II " for details.

The word " one " in the oracle bone inscriptions is used as a numeral. For example, "He Ji" 21575: "one cow." It can also indicate an ordinal number, that is, "first". For example, in "He Ji" 2703: "January." "Yu Yiren", all claimed by the king of Yin, "Compilation" 41027: "Yu Yiren died (no) ğ¡†¥ (worry)"

The golden inscription " one " is also used as a numeral, such as the big ding: "Yi (gi) female (ru) é¬¯ä¸€å£." Another example is the history of the beast ding with "ten and one month and Guiwei" as the year. Another Mao Gongding: "Yu Yi talents (in) stand up (position)", "Lu's Spring and Autumn. Tautology": "Wang Cheng said: "Yu Yiren and Yu Xiye." means "Wang Cheng said: "I just joked with Tang Shuyu." "Yu Yiren" is used in the same way as the oracle bone inscriptions.

Zhongshan Wang Fanghu borrowed from " mouse " from " one " to express " one ". Another example is "Baoshan Chujian. "Five Elements" borrows from " Yu " and " Neng " to express " one ". As the " a " word stroke is simple, easy to change the number, then later and more under the guise of "special One of One " as the word " a " of the capital. The " one " of the special one is now generally written as " one ". See " One ".

Meaning Mnemonic
Lying on the ground is something that looks just like the ground, the number One. Why is this One lying down? It's been shot by the number two. It's lying there, bleeding out and dying. The number One doesn't have long to live.
To remember the meaning of One, imagine yourself there at the scene of the crime. You grab One in your arms, trying to prop it up, trying to hear its last words. Instead, it just splatters some blood on your face. "Who did this to you?" you ask. The number One points weakly, and you see number Two running off into an alleyway. He's always been jealous of number One and knows he can be number one now that he's taken the real number one out.
Reading Mnemonic
As you're sitting there next to One, holding him up, you start feeling a weird sensation all over your skin. From the wound comes a fine powder (obviously coming from the special bullet used to kill One) that causes the person it touches to get extremely itchy (ã„ã¡).
Make sure you feel the ridiculously itchy sensation covering your body. It climbs from your hands, where you're holding the number One up, and then goes through your arms, crawls up your neck, goes down your body, and then covers everything. It becomes uncontrollable, and you're scratching everywhere, writhing on the ground. It's so itchy that it's the most painful thing you've ever experienced (you should imagine this vividly, so you remember the reading of this kanji).
